intro: Weinmannia karsteniana, commonly known as the Karsten's weinmannia, is a shrub or small tree native to the Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a rough, hairy texture and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
